item.description:
For those who wanted to go to the double feature of E.T. at 7:00 pm and The Goonies at 9:30 pm, I'm sorry to tell you that The Goonies has been cancelled... and has been replaced by a FREE Screening of the new film "Super 8" at 10:00 pm.

For those who are going to E.T. with me, I will be at the lower level Food Court at The Garage from 5:45 pm to 6:25 pm, and in front of the ticket booth picking up my Will Call ticket at 6:30 pm. We can grab seats by 6:40 pm.

I won't be able to meet-and-greet people who are just coming to Super 8, since it is bound to be crowded, but feel free to crash! You need to go to the Super8Secret site and RSVP to get on the list.

See you there!

-T.J. Maher

 

From the Brattle Website:

http://brattlefilm.org/2011/06/08/super-8/

"JJ Abrams wants you to be the FIRST to see Super 8, and he has chosen The Brattle Theatre to show it to you in BOSTON! Please join us for a free early screening on Wednesday, June 8th at 10:00pm at THE BRATTLE THEATRE.

"There will be free popcorn and soda, and a chance to win a Super 8 prize pack!  To RSVP, please go to www.Super8Secret.com and enter the password MINT.

-------------------------------------------------

On Wednesday, June 8th, as part of The Brattle Theater's Amblin Adventures film series, the Brattle Theater will be showing a Double Feature of E.T. (1982, Showtime @ 7:00 pm) and The Goonies (1985, Showtime @ 9:30 pm). Come join the Nerd Herd!

Wait a second... is Sloth the model for the idiot son of "Mom" in the cartoon "Futurama"?

And for those of you who aren't old enough for the orginal Electric Company, and have never caught an Errol Flynn movie, we have the Electric Company theme song  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TFYMijdQ_sA and the entire version of Errol Flynn's "Captain Blood" on YouTube http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=imNGQW-HDl8 so you can catch The Goonies references. Damn, that is a long movie. Maybe just a review of the movie would be better...  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KlK-MFaSoV4  

From the Brattle Theater Website:

http://brattlefilm.org/2011/06/02/the-goonies-2/ 

The Goonies:  "(1985) dir Richard Donner w/Sean Astin, Josh Brolin, Corey Feldman, Jonathan Ke Quan, Jeff Cohen, Kerri Green, Martha Plimpton, Anne Ramsey [114 min] A group of pint-sized misfits known as THE GOONIES, along with some older cool kids, go on a quest for ‘One-Eyed’ Willy’s lost pirate treasure in a bid to save their community from destruction to make way for a new golf course. They thought they were prepared for anything, but when they cross paths with the notorious Fratelli Family (headed by the evil Mama Fratelli (Ramsay) things get really hairy. An unforgettable adventure!"

E.T.: "(1982) dir Steven Spielberg w/Henry Thomas, Drew Barrymore, Peter Coyote, Dee Wallace, Robert MacNaughton [115 min] One of the most beloved movies of the 1980s, E.T.: THE EXTRA TERRESTRIAL is also the source of some of the most iconic movie images of all time. Ten-year-old Elliot discovers an alien in his family’s shed and decides to take him in. Teaching him how to communicate, the two form a special bond with unexpected results. As anyone who lived through the ’80s knows, E.T. is desperate to get home, and Elliot must put aside his feelings and help his friend before the government captures him."

 Price: $9.75 + Service charge (Select "Buy Tickets" at http://brattlefilm.org/2011/06/08/e-t-the-extra-terrestrial-2/... this will cover both The Goonies and E.T.). 

Where to Meet: 

T.J. Maher will be at lower level of the food court in The Garage in Harvard Square on 36 JFK Street http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-garage-cambridge, from 5:45 pm to 6:25 pm. We can commandeer tables and push them together as people arrive. A red MEETUP sign will be placed on the table, and a person suspiciously looking exactly like T.J. will be sitting next to it. We can take off at 6:25 pm, and walk to the Brattle Theater ticket booth, grabbing seats together at 6:40 pm. The screen is set far back because of a stage, so we usually can be found in the first or second row. 

T.J. is 5 foot 7, with short brown hair, blue eyes, a "Hello, My Name is T.J." namtag, and a red MEETUP sign attached to his black messenger bag.

Please mention if you are a YES or a MAYBE so T.J. can gauge how many people are coming, and if you are joining him in the food court so he can place tables together.   

 

About Amblin Adventures: 

http://brattlefilm.org/category/calendar-2/repertory-series/amblin-adventures/

"With the impending release of Super 8, J.J. Abrams homage to 80s/90s teenage adventure films, we take a look back at where it all started with the films of director/producer Steven Spielberg and his legendary Amblin Entertainment production company. Though the company officially debuted with the 1981 John Belushi vehicle Continental Divide, the majority of the films that Amblin produced during its first five years are among the most exciting adventure films of the 1980s: E.T. THE EXTRA-TERRESTRIAL, GREMLINS, THE GOONIES, BACK TO THE FUTURE and YOUNG SHERLOCK HOLMES. All had a remarkable effect on the generation of kids and teenagers that watched them – and no wonder; the heroes of these films are (despite their almost universal whiteness) realistic, relatable, relatively down-to-earth teens themselves. Even many of the Spielberg related films that pre-exist or are outside the Amblin ‘oeuvre’, like JAWS and POLTERGEIST, feature strong roles for teens and tweens even if they aren’t the center of the story. Of course, Amblin also counts many ‘grown-up’ films in the dozens that they’ve been behind – including The Color Purple, Empire of The Sun, Cape Fear, and Twister – but, for a certain generation, the iconic Amblin logo at the beginning of a film means you are in for a very fun ride and some quality entertainment".

About the Brattle:

http://brattlefilm.org/about-2/

"The Brattle shows the best in classic, cutting-edge, foreign, and art-house films. We also show first-run films and new releases of classic films, but our specialty is a repertory programming format consisting of films from a particular director, genre, or subject shown over the course of a week, or on the same weekday throughout the month. Visit our Series Archive to learn more about past repertory programs.

"Movies have been shown at the Brattle Theatre since 1953, when Bryant Haliday and Cyrus Harvey Jr. started things off with a screening of the German film, Der Hauptmann von Köpenick (The Captain from Köpenick)".

Trailers:

* E.T: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_7-2PB4jj2o&feature=player_embedded

* The Goonies: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pWgc8Ute2tU

Directions and Parking:

http://brattlefilm.org/about-2/directions-parking/

"The Brattle Theatre is located in Brattle Hall at 40 Brattle Street just one block from the Harvard Square MBTA Red Line T stop. We are located between Eastern Mountain Sports and the Cambridge Center for Adult Education. The building is shared with Algiers Cafe, Casablanca Restaurant, and Harvard Square Optical, and the theatre entrance is on the left side of the building—look for our sidewalk poster case and marquee.

"On-Street Parking

"Metered parking spaces are available throughout Harvard Square, however spaces are limited and competition for them can be difficult and time consuming. We recommend use of public transportation when possible, or choose one of the discount parking garages above".
item.how_to_find_us: We can meet outside the ticket booth by 6:30 pm.
item.name: E.T., The Goonies double feature @ Brattle Theater
